title: Dynamic sans-serif display. Who knows?
content:
Hi everybody,

I am looking for the name of the font below. It’s for a research on dynamic sans-serif fonts, sth like Brezel Grotesk, Founders Grotesk Condensed, etc.

Even if you can’t knock off this one, I am glad for any input for my ongoing research. So if you have other references like the ones already mentioned above, please, don’t hesitate!

Btw: grafik.net is using the font I am looking for in their newsletter!

Many thanks to all of you!

Best, Tobias.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Bildschirmfoto 2015-02-18 um 09.00.56.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317150529/http:/typophile.com/files/Bildschirmfoto%202015-02-18%20um%2009.00.56.png) | 27.99 KB |
author: tobiasholzmann

comments.content: — Edit: I got an untrusted connection with the newsletter link. That miniscule a is very distinctive.

Type ID requests should be posted here:  
 [http://typophile.com/typeid](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317150529/http:/typophile.com/typeid "http://typophile.com/typeid")

It appears to be Karla, a Google Web font:  
 [http://www.google.com/fonts/specimen/Karla](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317150529/http:/www.google.com/fonts/specimen/Karla "http://www.google.com/fonts/specimen/Karla")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317150529im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Karla_5614.png)
